alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 03 at 3:29PM AKDT until September 04 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is near or at bankfull from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs. Minor flooding is possible of low-lying areas near the river. Water levels will remain high early this week. For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana and Nenana Rivers, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of rising water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. A Flood Advisory is currently in effect until Noon Monday from Nenana to Old Minto. Please see that product for more details. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain that fell over the Alaska Range of the past week is causing high water on the Tanana River. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
